page.title: 17 FARMING_LHANBRYDE
page.content: There are different types of farms, mostly{mixed.}Barley,wheat and oats are grown. Barley is used as cattle food or to make whisky.Oats are used for cattle food or making porridge. Wheat is ground into flour to make cakes and biscuits. Dairy farms like Barmuckity supply milk to the Elgin area. Small herds of cattle are kept. Calves are fattened for slaughter or sold for breeding. There are a few small flocks of sheep bred for lamb or mutton. Recently a{mushroom}farm has been started at an old sawmill.They are grown in long,dark polythene "tents". Most farms are worked by the farmer and his family. They may employ workers part_time or at busy times. Some farms employ a contractor to lift the harvest.
